ch.lambdaj.function.closure
Class Closure

java.lang.Object
  ch.lambdaj.function.closure.Closure

public class Closure
extends Object

A generic (not strongly typed) lambdaj closure

Author:
Mario Fusco

public static final String CONSTRUCTOR
The name used to identify a closure that inokes a constructor

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Closure

public Closure()
Method Detail

apply

public Object apply(Object... vars)
             throws WrongClosureInvocationException
Invokes this closure once by applying the given set of variables to it.

Parameters:
vars - The set of variable used to invoke this closure once
Returns:
The result of the closure invocation
Throws:
WrongClosureInvocationException - if the number of the passed variables doesn't correspond to one with which this closure has been defined

each

public List<?> each(Object... vars)
             throws WrongClosureInvocationException
Invokes this closure once for each passed variable. It is then assumed that this closure has been defined with exactly one free variable

Parameters:
vars - The set of variables used to invoke this closure once for each variable
Returns:
A list of Object containing the results of each closure invocation
Throws:
WrongClosureInvocationException - if this closure hasn't been defined with exactly one free variable

each

public List<?> each(Iterable<?>... vars)
             throws WrongClosureInvocationException
Invokes this closure once for each passed set of variables. Each iterable is used as a different set of variables with which this closure is invoked

Parameters:
vars - The variables used to invoke this closure once for each set of variables
Returns:
A list of Object containing the results of each closure invocation
Throws:
WrongClosureInvocationException - if the number of the passed variables doesn't correspond to one with which this closure has been defined

curry

public Closure curry(Object curry,
                     int position)
              throws IllegalArgumentException
Curry this closure by fixing one of its free variable to a given value.

Parameters:
curry - The value to which the free variable should be curry
position - The 1-based position of the variable to which apply the curry operation
Returns:
A Closure having a free variable less than this one since one of them has been fixed to the given value
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if this closure doesn't have a free variable in the specified position

of

public Closure of(Object closedObject,
                  String methodName,
                  Object... args)
Defines the method invoked by this closure.

Parameters:
closedObject - The object on which the closure has to be invoked. It can be a fixed object or a Class. In this last case, if the method is not static, it is treated as it was an unbound argument defined through the Lambda.var(Class) method
methodName - The name of the method invoked by this closure or AbstractClosure.CONSTRUCTOR if you want to call a constructor
args - The arguments used to invoke this closure. They can be a mixed of fixed value and unbound one defined through the Lambda.var(Class) method
Returns:
The closure itself

of

public <T> T of(Class<T> closedClass)
Binds a free variable of the given class to the this closure.

Parameters:
closedClass - The type of the free variable to be bound to this closure
Returns:
A proxy of the same class of the passed class used to register all the invocation on the closed object

of

public <T> T of(T closed)
Binds an object to this closure.

Parameters:
closed - The object that has to be bound to this closure
Returns:
A proxy of the same class of the passed object used to register all the invocation on the closed object

of

public <T> T of(Object closed,
                Class<T> closedClass)
Binds an object to this closure.

Parameters:
closed - The object that has to be bound to this closure
closedClass - The actual class of the proxied object
Returns:
An instance of the closedClass that is actually a proxy used to register all the invocation on the closed object

getFreeVarsNumber

public int getFreeVarsNumber()
Returns the number of free variables in this closure

Returns:
The number of free variables in this closure

cast

public <T> T cast(Class<T> asInterface)
       throws IllegalArgumentException
Dynamically casts this closure to a one-method interface in order to invoke its method in a strongly typed way

Parameters:
asInterface - The interface to which this closure should be casted
Returns:
A proxy that implements the requested interface and wraps this closure
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the given Class is not actually an interface or if it has more than one method
